sentence.Network_en: This mammoth undertaking was completed in 18 months.
sentence.Network_cn: 这项艰巨的任务在18个月内完成了。

sentence.Network_en: a financial crisis of mammoth proportions
They made a gigantic [ huge ; mammoth ] demonstration against the government.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们举行了一次 声势浩大 的反政府示威.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 猛犸象（mammoth）得名于俄语“mammut”（意为长毛象），或称为“地下居住者”。直到300年前，猛犸象的骨骼仍然经常被认为是属 …
英文猛犸（Mammoth）一词来自俄文mammut，而俄文来自西伯利亚民族语言中的“地下潜伏的动物”，但是西伯利亚民族没并不了解 …
恐龙战队兽连者_百度百科 ... 霸王龙 Tyrannosaurus 长毛象（mammoth） Mammoth 三觭龙 Triceratops.
mammoth pump 大型泵mammoth 大型的man rack 管道工用平板篷车

猛犸洞（mammoth cave）（Mammoth Cave）被称为变化无穷的洞穴。概述结构特点猛犸洞（mammoth cave）其中的10英里对游客开放。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 18th cent.: from Russian mamo(n)t, probably of Siberian origin

entry.tran: （改变）巨大的，重大的；（任务）庞大的，艰巨的
entry.def: You can use mammoth to emphasize that a task or change is very large and needs a lot of effort to achieve.

example.ex: ...the mammoth task of relocating the library...
example.tran: 图书馆搬迁的艰巨任务

example.ex: You can only undertake mammoth changes if the finances are there...
example.tran: 资金到位的情况下方可进行重大变革。

entry.tran: 猛犸，毛象（一种史前动物）
entry.def: A mammoth was an animal like an elephant, with very long tusks and long hair, that lived a long time ago but no longer exists.

means.word_mean: 1. any of numerous extinct elephants widely distributed in the Pleistocene; extremely large with hairy coats and long upcurved tusks
1. so exceedingly large or extensive as to suggest a giant or mammoth;
